comments:
Build: I20061017
Vista RC1 (build 5600)

Hopefully someone with more SWT expertise will be able to decipher this. I was doing normal Java development, running some tests and clicking on test results in the JUnit view.  Eclipse suddenly became unresponsive, and stayed unresponsive for about 2.5 minutes.  During this time there were several strange errors in the long involving Image manipulation - array out of bounds, unsupported color depth, divide by zero, no more handles, etc.  Memory consumption climbed steadily from the typical 200-250MB range  up to 1.2GB, and then the process finally crashed with OutOfMemoryError. I don't know if this is a SWT Vista bug involving Image manipulation, or whether the Eclipse UI is doing something wrong with their images.  I will attach the full log. The OutOfMemoryError appeared on stdout:

java.lang.OutOfMemoryError
	at org.eclipse.swt.graphics.Image.getImageData(Image.java:1242)

thanks.
